metadata.name: Zpritez 3D #1003
metadata.description:
Generates interactive 3D pixel art sprites.
Each character also has a unique sound effect.
There are a variety of styles and backgrounds.
Click or touch to interact, position tweaks the sound.
Right click to save as a 1920x1080 image.

Code is based on my open source sprite generator ZzSprite.
https://github.com/KilledByAPixel/ZzSprite

Audio is using my open source sound effect system ZzFX.
https://github.com/KilledByAPixel/ZzFX

metadata.name: Yarn #8
metadata.description: Fabric is woven, with love, with care. But sometimes it is so dense that it is suffocating. Sometimes the yarns are too loose to hold on. I weave for you. I ask nothing in return.

metadata.name: Triangle Subdivisions #168
metadata.description:
A study on geometric triangle subdivisions resulted in this artwork.
Only 638 bytes of JavaScript are needed to create a variety of different subdivisions (and no libraries are used). 

One tile will be generated for every byte of code.  

An article about this technique can be seen here:
https://josvromans.com/blog/2021/1/triangle-subdivisions/

metadata.name: The Managed Miles - part 1 #217
metadata.description:
A bespoke literary chance machine, crafted from a matrix of ranked, hand-crafted options.
The style and tone of the generated output influences the title, to match the poem as closely as possible.

Based on an original poem in four verses. This is part 1 (plus title). 
Parts 2-4 releasing concurrently.

The algorithm that drives the poem is an evolving feature map. Each word has a series of features that, when selected, contribute to the selection of the following words.

In this way, the poem evolves in a way that is deterministic but with very random roots. 

The chance of two transactions generating the same poem from the system is about 1 in 450,000.

Wily Guys [ T : @guyswily / W : wilyguys.com / I : @wilyguys / M : wilyguys.medium.com ] 
Liam Egan [ T : @neuromantic6 / W : github.com/liamegan / I : @liamgegan ]

metadata.name: Stippled Sketch #271
metadata.description:
Stippled Sketch is an experimental attempt to imitate the result of sitting down and mindlessly finding form on the page. The process of pressing the pen to paper in a rhythmic, repeated pattern can be a form of meditation, much like doodling. 

The form at the center of the sketch can sometimes take a clear and recognizable shape, but it can also appear meandering and meaningless at times. Some forms appear more often than others (such as a clover and circle), but the equation at the core of the algorithm has surprised me quite a few times with unique and unusual shapes, even after reviewing thousands of previews. 

I like to think of this collection as a reflection of a time in my life when I wanted to say so much‚Äîand I could put the pen to the paper, but I knew that no words would have any effect, so I sketched to focus my attention on something else instead. 

‚Äî ‚Äî ‚Äî ‚Äî ‚Äî ‚Äî ‚Äî ‚Äî ‚Äî ‚Äî ‚Äî ‚Äî ‚Äî ‚Äî ‚Äî ‚Äî ‚Äî ‚Äî ‚Äî ‚Äî ‚Äî ‚Äî ‚Äî 
Special thanks to Laurent Houdard and Lisa Orth for helping with a few technical aspects.

metadata.name: Spaghettiz #24
metadata.description:
Randomized colorful spaghetti strings in all kinds of variations and levels of chaos.
- @TeNinEightNFTs

Created with p5.js

metadata.name: Rondelle, Listen #52
metadata.description:
Tap to start sound. Tap to mute.

Inspired by the glass rondelles which hung from the windowsill in my childhood home. I ask myself what would these rondelles sound like if they reflected sound instead of light? To me, I hear hopeful harmonies of memories past, but they are falling in and out of tune and they are occluded by the muffled noise of time.

When a rondelle is minted, a transaction hash is injected into its code. All colors, patterns, sounds, and motions are generated deterministically from this transaction hash.

As the rondelle loads in your browser, a real-time generative algorithm writes tones, noise, feedback, and distortion to three looping audio buffers. During playback, oscillations in pan, pitch, and volume track the visual oscillations among the rondelle's color rings.

Rarity features are included. The least common rondelles are closed center, monochrome, smol, split color, and square.

Made with Web Audio and p5js. Minted on fxhash beta. Idlebit, 2021.

metadata.name: Ries #294
metadata.description:
Ries is 500 sheets of paper. 
Ries is an cut-up text-artwork.
Ries is artwork generated by an algorithm based on seeded random numbers.
Ries is a digital artwork installed in 5 forms in exhibitions setting.
Ries is an NFT artwork. 

Ries is an artwork where I try bring together my experience of doing gallery exhibitions, my love for generative and copy machine art, DIY-punk aesthetics, NFT‚Äôs and chaos. 

The edition of Ries will be installed in different forms and collages in a gallery exhibition in Walden Kunstaustellungen in Berlin in July of 2022. Opening is at 8.7. 19.00, welcome if you are in Berlin.
/www.galerie-walden.de/

The seed idea for the project was the method of cut-up where a text (or something else) is cut into pieces and then rearranged to form something new. A modified Markov‚Äôs Chain algorithm makes a small text or a group of words from a pool of texts that include Art texts about cut up technique and generative art talk from tweets. These words form a visual bottom layer and then another layer of words samples the first, cutting it up and thus following the theme of the artwork.

Since the single iterations of the project are designed to be used in a collage, they come in various tone, density, detail and scale. One can test from the variations button and get a sense of what the generator produces. 

Controls in live view:
-Pressing  j exports the current image as jpeg
-Pressing  p  exports the current image as png

To change the detail level one can access the pixel density of render by adding ?pixDens=4 to the end of the URL in live view. You can of course you any number other than 4 also. I it renders just a black image, you have to lower the number, since it is then too large for WEBGL to render.

Designed to be best rendered on desktop Chrome.

Pricing info
22 tez - Includes a gallery shown, signed print sent to minter by mail or by telefax(!)
11 tez - A fair price for an artwork, also the minter can personally pick up a signed gallery shown print from the gallery, after the exhibition.
5 tez - 1/2 fair price
2 tez - bottom dollar

If you minted on lower tiers and would want a print, please contact the artist per twitter dm to ‚Äúupgrade‚Äù. If you bought secondary, and would want a print, please contact the artist per twitter dm.

Features exist mostly to help with artwork pairing for the collectors.


Markov‚Äôs chain code core is based on Markov Me! By https://codepen.io/alexkramerbanjo , MIT License

Displacement shader based on the wonderful shader examples by Adam Ferris


The artist holds the right to use the whole edition of Ries for display purposes for future exhibitions without asking permission or notifying the owners of the NFT‚Äôs.

1.7.2022 in Berlin
Antti Pussinen

www.anttipussinen.net
www.twitter.com/antti_pussinen
www.instagram.com/anttipussinen
